instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used for the thickness measurement of TBCs in the proposed model of Elman neural network optimized by whale optimization algorithm (WOA) with principal component analysis (PCA) based on singular value decomposition (SVD)?
Output: The proposed model used terahertz (THz) spectrum for the thickness measurement of TBCs.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the proposed model for the terahertz (THz)-based thickness measurement of TBCs?
Output: Wavelet analysis and stationary wavelet transform combined with back propagation (BP) neural network were used in the proposed model for the terahertz (THz)-based thickness measurement of TBCs.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the models in the thickness measurement of TBCs and how far can this metric go?
Output: Four quantitative evaluated indexes were used to evaluate the performance of the models in the thickness measurement of TBCs. The maximum relative error (MRE) of TC thickness between real value and prediction was 0.48% using the PCA-Elman model, and it dropped to 0.14% through optimization.

instruction: How were the weights and biases of the Elman neural network optimized in the proposed model for the terahertz (THz)-based thickness measurement of TBCs?
Output: In the proposed model for the terahertz (THz)-based thickness measurement of TBCs, the weights and biases of the Elman neural network were optimized using the whale optimization algorithm (WOA). The WOA is a metaheuristic optimization algorithm inspired by the hunting behavior of humpback whales. It is used to search for the optimal solution by iteratively updating the positions of a population of candidate solutions, which in this case are the weights and biases of the neural network. The WOA algorithm aims to strike a balance between exploration and exploitation to avoid falling into local optima and improve the accuracy of the neural network's output. By applying the WOA optimization technique, the weights and biases of the Elman neural network in the proposed model were adjusted to enhance the performance and accuracy of the thickness measurement method.

instruction: Can the proposed model using Elman neural network optimized by whale optimization algorithm (WOA) with principal component analysis (PCA) based on singular value decomposition (SVD) be used to measure the thickness of TBCs using spectroscopic methods in aero-engines?
Output: Yes, the proposed model using Elman neural network optimized by whale optimization algorithm (WOA) with principal component analysis (PCA) based on singular value decomposition (SVD) can be used to measure the thickness of thermal barrier coatings (TBCs) using spectroscopic methods in aero-engines. The model utilizes terahertz (THz)-based thickness measurement of TBCs and employs a theoretical model of THz propagation in TBC to generate simulated signals for training the neural network. The use of PCA based on SVD helps reduce the dimension of each signal, and the optimization of weights and biases by WOA improves the accuracy of the neural network. The results of the study indicate that the proposed method has the potential for accurate thickness measurement of TBCs and can be applied in aero-engines.
